intro: Calandrinia spergularina, commonly known as the "pink rockrose," is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to arid environments, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Calandrinia spergularina is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
